item.title: Intense mental exercise may be able to offset the effects of aging, research finds
item.description: A new study shows that cognitive training can increase the levels of a key chemical messenger in the brain responsible for decision-making.

item.title: For years, men controlled one village's coffee industry — but one woman changed that
item.description: Meridah Nandudu was a single mom of two kids, unemployed and in despair. Then she had an idea: Maybe the "humble" coffee beans she'd grown up with on ...

item.title: A study found lead in popular protein powders. Here's why you shouldn't panic
item.description: Consumer Reports expressed concern about high levels of lead in some two dozen protein powders, but only with repeated high exposure. Here's what to k...

item.title: 'Death fold' proteins can make cells self-destruct. Scientists want to control them
item.description: Scientists are hoping to treat diseases including cancer and Alzheimer's by influencing how cells make life-or-death decisions.

item.title: Health insurance premiums are going up next year — unless you work at these companies
item.description: As U.S. health insurance costs rise, some companies are paying for all of their workers' premiums. It's a big expense — but they say it pays off.
